metadata.title: CVE-2022-24895 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: Symfony is a PHP framework for web and console applications and a set ofreusable PHP components. When authenticating users Symfony by defaultregenerates the session ID upon login, but preserves the rest of sessionattributes. Because this does not clear CSRF tokens upon login, this mightenables same-site attackers to bypass the CSRF protection mechanism byperforming an attack similar to a session-fixation. This issue has beenfixed in the 4.4 branch.

criterions.comment: symfony package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
